title: 107_s252
content: The Act titled "Clean Water Infrastructure Financing Act of 2001" amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to provide general authority for capitalization grants to accomplish the Act's purposes. The Clean Water Infrastructure Financing Act of 2001 amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to update requirements for construction of treatment works and provide guidance for small systems. The Administrator shall publish a manual to assist small systems in obtaining assistance under this title and provide notice of its availability in the Federal Register. The term 'small system' refers to a system serving a population of 20,000 or fewer inhabitants seeking assistance under this title. SEC. 4. WATER POLLUTION CONTROL REVOLVING FUNDS. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act amends Section 603 to specify eligible activities for assistance from the water pollution control revolving fund, including construction of treatment works, lake protection programs, and nonpoint source management programs. The water pollution control revolving fund can be used for various activities such as estuary conservation, riparian area protection, improving water use efficiency, preventing water pollution, and acquiring land for mitigation requirements related to treatment works construction. A State's revolving fund is established, maintained, and credited with repayments for providing financial assistance in perpetuity. Fees collected can only be used for administering the fund. Financially distressed communities may have an extended repayment period of up to 40 years or the expected life of the project. The loan guarantees under the Federal Water Pollution Control Act are amended to include revolving funds for municipalities and innovative technologies. Administrative expenses are also addressed in the amendments. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to include loan guarantees for municipalities and innovative technologies, as well as addressing administrative expenses. Additionally, technical and planning assistance is provided to small systems for improving wastewater treatment plant operations. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to include loan guarantees for municipalities and innovative technologies, as well as addressing administrative expenses. Furthermore, activities to improve wastewater treatment plant operations are limited to 2 percent of grants provided to the fund for the fiscal year. Construction assistance from the water pollution control revolving fund of the State is subject to priority list requirements. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to include loan guarantees for municipalities and innovative technologies. Treatment works can be considered publicly owned if they treat municipal waste water or domestic sewage. Financially distressed communities may receive loans with principal subsidization. The State may provide additional subsidization to financially distressed communities receiving loans, with a limit of 30% of the capitalization grant. The Administrator can publish information to help States establish affordability criteria, and priority can be given to financially distressed communities in loan allocation. Financially distressed communities are defined by meeting affordability criteria set by the State. The State must establish and develop community affordability criteria through public review and comment. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to authorize $3,000,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2002 through 2006.
